column3:
For reference:

Ubuntu LTS (bionic): 3.6.5
Debian stable (stretch): 3.5.3
RHEL 8 (expected before v0.19): 3.6.x
Gentoo stable: 3.6.5
Arch: 3.7.1

Concept ACK. Release notes for 3.5 are here: https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html . I think for this project, the most interesting new features could be:

- [Type hints](https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html#whatsnew-pep-484)
- [Coroutines with async and await syntax](https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html#whatsnew-pep-492)

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#15482](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/15482.html) (Implement BIPXXX's new softfork rules (The
Concept ACK. \n+1 on being able to start using [Type Hints](https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html#pep-484-type-hints).
@jnewbery You might be interested in reviewing this, since it removes some python2.7 leftovers from  "Remove Python2 support" in #11881

Looks good. I especially like _scripted-diff: test: Remove brackets after assert_  :100: Is there a flake warning we can add to enforce in that in future?\n\nThis is for inclusion in v0.19, so I'll review after v0.18 is forked.

tACK faa7cdf except PyEnv needs a full version number, i.e. `3.5.6`. With that, I was able to run `make check` and the functional test suite on macOS 10.14.3, but I didn't try the various linters and other tools.
utACK dddd1d0. Travis failure on `p2p_invalid_messages.py` seems spurious.
> Travis failure on p2p_invalid_messages.py seems spurious.\n\nI restarted the job.
tACK fa27978. It's a new commit on top of dddd1d0, not a rebase; the force push only replaced an earlier version of that new commit.
